intro: Viviania domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican arrowroot, is a herbaceous plant native to the Caribbean islands. It belongs to the family Araceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white, spadix-like inflorescences surrounded by a spathe. Its rhizomes are edible and have been traditionally used for their starchy properties. Viviania domingensis thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
